source_text: *Suicide, my ass*, was my instant, and silent, reaction. Why hadn't Sybil hired me to come out here to read his grave first, instead of sending me to the woods to find Teenie? Of course this boy hadn't shot himself. Dell Teague had been murdered, just like his wild girlfriend. I opened my eyes. Hollis Boxleitner had swung around to check on what I was doing. I looked into the intent face of the deputy. "No suicide here," I said.
translation_attempt: *Bunuh diri, omong kosong*, reaksi instan dan terdiam saya. Mengapa Sybil tidak mempekerjakan saya untuk datang ke sini untuk melihat makamnya terlebih dahulu, alih-alih mengirim saya ke hutan untuk mencari Teenie? Tentu saja anak ini tidak bunuh diri. Dell Teague dibunuh, sama seperti pacar gila mereka. Saya membuka mata. Hollis Boxleitner berbalik untuk melihat apa yang sedang saya lakukan. Saya menatap wajah serius seorang wakil. "Tidak ada bunuh diri di sini," kataku.
rubric:
semantic_accuracy: True
tonal_fidelity: True
natural_fluency: True
nuance_preservation: False
feedback: While the translation demonstrates a generally acceptable understanding of the source text's meaning (Semantic Accuracy - PASS) and maintains a similar tone (Tonal Fidelity - PASS) and reads reasonably well (Natural Fluency - PASS), it significantly fails to capture the nuance of the original. The phrase "Bunuh diri, omong kosong" is a direct translation of "Suicide, my ass," which lacks the sarcastic, dismissive, and somewhat vulgar tone of the original. The Indonesian phrasing is too literal and doesn't convey the same level of cynicism and disbelief. Furthermore, the phrasing "wajah serius seorang wakil" (serious face of a deputy) is grammatically correct but sounds somewhat formal and stiff. A more natural and idiomatic translation would be preferable to better convey the casual, slightly detached observation of the speaker. The failure to adequately translate the subtle, sarcastic tone of the original text is a critical flaw. This nuance is vital to the character's voice and the overall atmosphere of the excerpt. Therefore, despite the other strengths of the translation, the overall quality is insufficient and requires revision to accurately reflect the source material's intent. The lack of nuance preservation necessitates a "needs_revision" grade.

source_text: *Suicide, my ass*, was my instant, and silent, reaction. Why hadn't Sybil hired me to come out here to read his grave first, instead of sending me to the woods to find Teenie? Of course this boy hadn't shot himself. Dell Teague had been murdered, just like his wild girlfriend. I opened my eyes. Hollis Boxleitner had swung around to check on what I was doing. I looked into the intent face of the deputy. "No suicide here," I said.
translation_attempt: "Bunuh diri? Masa sih?" begitu reaksi instan dan terdiam saya. Kenapa Sybil tidak mempekerjakan saya untuk memeriksa makamnya dulu, daripada mengirim saya ke hutan mencari Teenie? Tentu saja anak ini tidak bunuh diri. Dell Teague dibunuh, sama seperti pacar wanitanya yang penuh sesak. Saya membuka mata. Hollis Boxleitner telah berbalik untuk melihat apa yang saya lakukan. Saya menatap wajah tanpa ekspresi seorang wakil. "Bukan bunuh diri," ucap saya.

tonal_fidelity: True
natural_fluency: True

The tone is maintained effectively – the sarcastic and slightly detached voice of the narrator is preserved in the Indonesian translation. The language used is natural and reads smoothly, avoiding any awkward phrasing. Crucially, the nuance of the original is also successfully captured. The use of "masa sih?" effectively conveys the incredulity and dismissive attitude of the narrator. The translation successfully avoids sounding overly formal or stilted. There are no significant errors or misinterpretations. This is a strong translation and meets the required standards.

source_text: I don't like being treated like a confidence trickster, and I'm sure Tolliver likes it even less. I retreat inside myself, and I don't let them touch my quick. Tolliver tries to do that, too, but he is less successful. He gets very upset when people impugn our honor.
translation_attempt: Aku tidak suka diperlakukan seperti penipu ulung, dan aku yakin Tolliver bahkan lebih membencinya. Aku menarik diri ke dalam diriku sendiri, dan tidak membiarkan mereka menyentuh kesadaranku. Tolliver mencoba melakukan itu juga, tetapi dia kurang berhasil. Dia sangat kesal ketika orang mencoreng kehormatan kita.

translation_attempt: Aku tidak suka diperlakukan seperti penipu ulung, dan aku yakin Tolliver bahkan lebih tidak suka lagi. Aku menarik diri ke dalam diriku sendiri, dan aku tidak membiarkan mereka menyentuh kepalaku. Tolliver mencoba melakukan itu juga, tetapi dia kurang berhasil. Dia sangat kesal ketika orang mencoreng kehormatan kami.

source_text:
"Tell me about your dream house," Hollis said, smiling.

"Okay," I said, slowly. This was something I didn't talk about too often. "It will have to be off the beaten road, of course. I want it to look like a log cabin, but without the inconveniences of a real log cabin. I found a plan on the Internet, and I bought it. But of course, I want to alter it a little."

"Of course," he said, taking a sip of beer. "

It would be two bedrooms and a study, with a family room. There'd be a kitchen here, with the washroom right off of it." I was looking down at the table, drawing with my finger. "Around back, there'd be a *porte cochere* for the cars, so you could carry groceries right into the kitchen without getting wet. There's a deck off the right side of the kitchen, see? Or maybe I'd put it off the family room. That's where the fireplace will be, and you could keep your firewood on the deck. And you could put your gas grill on the deck. For steaks."
translation_attempt:
"Ceritakan tentang rumah impianmu," kata Hollis sambil tersenyum.

"Baiklah," jawabku, perlahan. Ini adalah sesuatu yang jarang sekali aku bicarakan. "Tentu saja, rumah itu harus jauh dari keramaian. Aku ingin tampilannya seperti pondok kayu, tetapi tanpa ketidaknyamanan pondok kayu sungguhan. Aku menemukan gambaran rencananya di Internet, dan aku membelinya. Tapi tentu saja, aku ingin mengubahnya sedikit."

"Tentu," katanya, sambil mengicipi bir.

Akan ada dua kamar tidur dan sebuah ruang kerja, dengan ruang keluarga. Akan ada dapur di sini, dengan kamar mandi tepat di sampingnya. Aku menunduk melihat meja, menggambar dengan jariku. "Di belakang, akan ada *porte cochere* untuk mobil, jadi kamu bisa membawa belanjaan langsung ke dapur tanpa basah. Ada teras di sisi kanan dapur, lihat? Atau mungkin aku akan menempatkannya di samping ruang keluarga. Di sanalah perapian akan berada, dan kamu bisa menyimpan kayu bakar di teras. Dan kamu bisa meletakkan pemanggang gas di teras. Untuk steak."
rubric:
semantic_accuracy: True
tonal_fidelity: True
natural_fluency: True
nuance_preservation: True
feedback: The translation is remarkably well done. It accurately conveys the meaning of the source text without any significant loss of information. The tone is consistent with the original, maintaining a casual and conversational style. The Indonesian used is natural and reads smoothly, avoiding any awkward phrasing. Crucially, the translation successfully preserves the nuance of the *porte cochere* and the details surrounding the deck and grill, rendering them in a way that is understandable and appropriate within the context. There are no glaring errors or stylistic missteps. While a more literary translator *might* explore more evocative phrasing, this translation prioritizes clarity and accuracy, and succeeds admirably. Therefore, it is deemed acceptable.
